(Oh and I highly recommend this. Can't recommend it enough!)

Look, if you're trying to dip your toes into the Company of Heroes universe, this is where you wanna start. The OG game hit different back in 2006 and honestly? Still slaps today.

The graphics were mind-blowing for the time - buildings actually crumble realistically and your dudes take cover like they've got actual survival instincts. Revolutionary stuff back then. Sure, it looks a bit dated now, but it's got that charming "peak mid-2000s PC gaming" vibe going on.

Gameplay-wise, it nailed the sweet spot between micro-managing every single soldier and just throwing units at the enemy until something sticks. The cover system, resource points, and squad-based tactics were pretty fresh for the era, and they're still the backbone of why this series rocks.

Perfect entry point? Absolutely. You get the core mechanics without all the extra bells and whistles from later games. Plus, the WWII setting hits that nostalgic spot, and the campaign does a solid job teaching you the ropes without holding your hand too much.

Bottom line: It's aged like a fine wine, not like milk. Great for understanding what made this franchise legendary, and you can usually snag it for dirt cheap during sales. Worth it.

TL:DR; Some prefer this to the sequel, Its a very solid first entry that has genuinely expansive and quality expansion packs/DLC.

CoH 1 is interesting to compare to its sequel and DoW 2 -it has a slightly higher priority on base-building and whilst each faction does have its fair share of differences I'd say they're less different feeling than in CoH 2. They all have their niches; Americans are fast and adaptive, Germans 1 are slow and tough, Brits are defensive and sneaky, and Germans 2 are experimental and on wheels.

There's not a lot to say other than it pioneered the squad & cover based gameplay that the gaming community really enjoyed to the point it made its way into different franchises made by Relic. The campaigns are fun and unlike CoH 2 you get one for EVERY faction, not just the starting two.

I can't speak to the multiplayer scene or balance, but I always got the impression this was better balanced than its sequel on that front- god help you trying to get into it now. Old multiplayer games like these without proper skill-matchmaking tend to calcify their gaming community quickly into "you are statistically much more likely to come across someone so above your skill level you may as well be a chew toy" and this dries up the pool of even and fun matches for anyone new.

Even not on sale its pretty cheap, and it goes on sale a lot. I heavily recommend it to fans of strategy games, and this goes for the expansion packs too.

[h1] [i] "Company of Heroes is one of the classic RTS games set in WWII." [/i] [/h1]
[hr][/hr]
Here you will find yourself commanding American troops taking part in the most famous operations in occupied France.
You will have to prepare the ground for the landing troops, using the airborne divisions, before the Normandy landings, the armored divisions during Operation Cobra and infantry units to take the city of Cherbourg.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3592721145
The units in the game are very detailed and it is also possible to add improvements to make them more specialized or with greater offensive power.
Armored vehicles, for example, very well represented the diversity of armor (front, side, and rear), making it even more challenging for the player to face these units.
Infantry, can pick up equipment dropped by the enemy and utilize the various cover options available on the maps.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3587148068
The resources that will allow you to build or recruit new units and structures will be collected by conquering certain key points on the map.
The graphics, although dated, allow you to appreciate the various effects present: explosions, tracer bullets and the "ricochet" of anti-tank rounds.
The sound department is up to par: the sounds of weapons and explosions are perfectly realized, as are the voices and exclamations of the men in the various situations present.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3589377071
The game is certainly showing its age, but being a must-have for all fans of the genre and boasting several expansions that expand the available campaigns, it's still a good buy. (Especially because it's cheap =D)

This game is absolutely amazing, it has definitely withstood the test of time. Gameplay, sound design , and AI are all perfect, it's also really to learn which is a plus for me. 10/10 would recommend.

This was probably one of the most underrated RTS games of its time. It was somehow new with fresh ideas, good teamwork and strategy balance. So when it came out and with all expansions it was a really good game overall even with poor balance issues. I remember playing it using Hamachi and other software at that time, it was a good times. 

But, this game aged really poorly. Starting with real unit\forces balance issues, poor rating matchmaking and ofcourse nothing ruins a good game but a bad community. And this always was one of the toxiest. Even in new games you can see that. 

Todays state of game is somewhere near 2\5. You can still have some fun with friends, but the amount of cheeze and maphack little guys will ruin all the fun. (Yes i know the counter strats, No im not a noob i played the game since the begining of times without steam).

It was a good game but its sadly a time to let her go.

Game itself is not bad, however missions feel like its stretched for whatever reason, you gotta hold army for 1 hour and there is no timer nothing overall game experience feels like a sandbox not a campaign and cut scenes are chopped, no story whats so ever.

I think it is nostalgia what keeps people giving good reviews. The game from a strategic point is very poor. The mechanics are very badly designed. The troops do not respond well. It is in all ways a very poor game

I remember playing it using Hamachi and other software at that time, it was a good times. 

But, this game aged really poorly. Starting with real unit\forces balance issues, poor rating matchmaking and ofcourse nothing ruins a good game but a bad community. And this always was one of the toxiest. Even in new games you can see that. 

Todays state of game is somewhere near 2\5. You can still have some fun with friends, but the amount of cheeze and maphack little guys will ruin all the fun. (Yes i know the counter strats, No im not a noob i played the game since the begining of times without steam).

It was a good game but its sadly a time to let her go.

Game itself is not bad, however missions feel like its stretched for whatever reason, you gotta hold army for 1 hour and there is no timer nothing overall game experience feels like a sandbox not a campaign and cut scenes are chopped, no story whats so ever.

I think it is nostalgia what keeps people giving good reviews. The game from a strategic point is very poor. The mechanics are very badly designed. The troops do not respond well. It is in all ways a very poor game
